catalog_info.title: Strategies for Political Inquiry
catalog_info.notes: Primarily for graduate students; may also be taken by undergraduates preparing for senior thesis research.
catalog_info.description: Research design for causal inference in qualitative and quantitative studies. Topics covered include measurement, conceptualization, case studies, the relationship between large-n and small-n studies, process-tracing, surveys, field experiments, and natural experiments, with examples of their use in political science.
